Package com.sanyavertolet.interview.math

Enum Class Function

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Function>
com.sanyavertolet.interview.math.Function
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Function>, Constable
public enum Function extends Enum<Function>
An enum representing various built-in functions that can be evaluated in expressions. Each function has a defined number of arguments and a specific implementation for its evaluation.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Enum Constant Details

    • PI

      public static final Function PI
      Represents the mathematical constant pi. It provides a value of approximately 3.14159. No arguments are needed for this function.

    • E

      public static final Function E
      Represents the mathematical constant e. It provides a value of approximately 2.71828. No arguments are needed for this function.

    • POW

      public static final Function POW
      Computes the result of raising the first argument (base) to the power of the second argument (exponent). Requires two arguments: the base and the exponent.

    • SIN

      public static final Function SIN
      Calculates the sine of an angle given in radians. Requires one argument: the angle in radians.

    • COS

      public static final Function COS
      Calculates the cosine of an angle given in radians. Requires one argument: the angle in radians.

    • TAN

      public static final Function TAN
      Calculates the tangent of an angle given in radians. Requires one argument: the angle in radians.

    • CTG

      public static final Function CTG
      Calculates the cotangent of an angle given in radians, which is the reciprocal of the tangent. Requires one argument: the angle in radians.

    • ASIN

      public static final Function ASIN
      Computes the arcsine (inverse sine) of a value, returning the angle in radians. Requires one argument: the value for which the arcsine is to be calculated.

    • ACOS

      public static final Function ACOS
      Computes the arccosine (inverse cosine) of a value, returning the angle in radians. Requires one argument: the value for which the arccosine is to be calculated.

    • ATAN

      public static final Function ATAN
      Computes the arc-tangent (inverse tangent) of a value, returning the angle in radians. Requires one argument: the value for which the arc-tangent is to be calculated.

    • LN

      public static final Function LN
      Computes the natural logarithm (base e) of a value. Requires one argument: the value for which the natural logarithm is to be calculated.

    • LOG

      public static final Function LOG
      Computes the logarithm of a value with a specified base. Requires two arguments: the value and the base for the logarithm calculation. The base must be greater than 1.

    • ABS

      public static final Function ABS
      Computes the absolute value of a number. Requires one argument: the value for which the absolute value is to be calculated.

    • CBRT

      public static final Function CBRT
      Computes the cube root of a number. Requires one argument: the value for which the cube root is to be calculated.

    • SQRT

      public static final Function SQRT
      Computes the square root of a number. Requires one argument: the value for which the square root is to be calculated.

    • MIN

      public static final Function MIN
      Computes the minimum of two numbers. Requires two arguments: the values to compare.

    • MAX

      public static final Function MAX
      Computes the maximum of two numbers. Requires two arguments: the values to compare.

    • CEILING

      public static final Function CEILING
      Computes the smallest integer greater than or equal to a number. Requires one argument: the value for which the ceiling is to be calculated.

    • FLOOR

      public static final Function FLOOR
      Computes the largest integer less than or equal to a number. Requires one argument: the value for which the floor is to be calculated.

    • MOD

      public static final Function MOD
      Computes the remainder of the division of two integers. Requires two arguments: the dividend and the divisor. The divisor must not be zero.

    • CONTAINS

      public static final Function CONTAINS
      Checks if a string contains a specified substring. Requires two arguments: the string and the substring to search for.

    • CONCAT

      public static final Function CONCAT
      Concatenates two strings. Requires two arguments: the strings to concatenate.

    • REPEAT

      public static final Function REPEAT
      Repeats a string a specified number of times. Requires two arguments: the string to repeat and the number of times to repeat it.

    • LENGTH

      public static final Function LENGTH
      Computes the length of a string. Requires one argument: the string whose length is to be calculated.

    • STRING

      public static final Function STRING
      Converts a value to a string representation. Requires one argument: the value to be converted to a string.

    • SUM

      public static final Function SUM
      Computes the sum of values in a range. Requires one argument: the range of values to sum.

    • AVERAGE

      public static final Function AVERAGE
      Computes the average of values in a range. Requires one argument: the range of values to average.

    • COUNT

      public static final Function COUNT
      Counts the number of values in a range. Requires one argument: the range of values to count.

    • IF

      public static final Function IF
      Returns one of two values based on a condition. Requires three arguments: the condition, the value if true, and the value if false.

    • IFERROR

      public static final Function IFERROR
      Returns one of two values based on whether an expression results in an error. Requires two arguments: the expression to evaluate and the value to return if there is an error.

    • values

      public static Function[] values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum class, in the order they are declared.
      Returns:

    • valueOf

      public static Function valueOf(String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this class with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this class. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
      Returns:
      the enum constant with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if this enum class has no constant with the specified name
      NullPointerException - if the argument is null

    • getArgumentsSize

      public Integer getArgumentsSize()
      Returns the number of arguments required by the function.
      Returns:
      the number of arguments required by the function.

    • evaluate

      public Value evaluate(List<Value> arguments) throws ExpressionEvaluationException
      Evaluates the function with the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      arguments - the list of Value objects representing the function arguments.
      Returns:
      the result of the function evaluation as a Value.
      Throws:
      ExpressionEvaluationException - if the number of arguments is incorrect or if an error occurs during evaluation.

    • named

      public static Function named(String name)
      Returns a Function based on its name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the function (case-insensitive).
      Returns:
      the corresponding Function.
